definition: plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: We must keep away excessive lavish and .
sentences.chinese: 我們必須避免過分放縱和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: Soft film ceiling maintenance is very simple, do not waste too much of your time.
sentences.chinese: 軟膜天花的保養實在很簡樸，不會鋪張你太多時間。

sentences.english: Mubarak. They don't live an elaborate lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 他們的生活也並不奢靡鋪張。

sentences.english: Avoid extravagance or risky financial schemes.
sentences.chinese: 避免鋪張浪費或風險性財務方案。

sentences.english: Sponging and taking more than one's share and extravagance and waste on the part of cadres must be banned.
sentences.chinese: 杜絕幹部多吃多佔和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: Meggie was so against a fuss she even refused to wear bridal regalia.
sentences.chinese: 麥琪大力反對鋪張，甚至拒絕穿華麗的新婚禮服。

sentences.english: We must live with moderation and avoid waste.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須避免過分放縱和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: For the past few decades, we have been able to be wasteful and get by.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的幾十年裏，我們鋪張浪費，得過且過。

sentences.english: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 他獨自鋪張蒼天，步行在海浪之上。

sentences.english: If your spread yourself too thin, you won't create a spark.
sentences.chinese: 如果你過分鋪張，你不會產生火星兒。

sentences.english: We should avoid over-indulge and wasting.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須避免過分放縱和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: Some indian people indulge in wedding extravaganza.
sentences.chinese: 有些印度人沈迷於婚禮的大肆鋪張。

sentences.english: We must avoid overindulgence and conspicuous consumption.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須避免過分放縱和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: who stretches out the heavens like a curtain and spreads them like a tent to live in.
sentences.chinese: 他鋪張穹蒼如幔子，展開諸天如可住的帳棚。

sentences.english: They don’t live an elaborate lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 他們的生活也並不奢靡鋪張。

definition: untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
to frame sb/to cook up imaginary charges against sb
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
